name: Wir fahren und fliegen gegen Engeland!
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 100 wins the game.

This NS-propaganda game was published as a supplement to the newspaper "Die Post - die Zeitung für jeden" during WW II.

—user summary
categories: Aviation / Flight, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Br√ºcken-Spiel
description:
The corner-pillars are covered with 2 figures of the same color. The figures must travel to the opposite corner-pillar and must take the way over all the four bridges and through a custom-house. The players move by turns. The adversary orders how many spaces the other is obliged to move; he only has the choice to order four, five or seven spaces. For instance white says to blue: "move four spaces!"

Movement is restricted by the following rules;

Who comes to a red space at the end of the ordered movement is obliged to go back one space.
Who comes to a white space in the middle of a bridge is obliged to go back three spaces.
He who comes to one white square in the middle of the custom-house is obliged to return six squares.
Who arrives at a red square or on a bridge in going back has the right to stop there, only in the custom-house no figure has the right to stop, it must go back to one square in front of the custom-barrier.
Who is at the move, has the choice, which of his 2 figures he likes to move.
If a figure would get on a space, occupied by a figure of another color, it has the right to jump over the adversary or more, if the spaces behind them are free.


The players try to make their adversary's move slowly. This happens if one directs his adversary to a space from which he is obliged to move back a number of spaces.
The winner is the first player who has his 2 figures at the opposite pillar.

—user summary
mechanics: Race, Track Movement

name: Sammich!
description:
A sandwich building game with looney llamas, spy squirrels, and inconvenient camel and more! Be the first to feed your llama three specialty sammiches!

Play cards each turn to add the necessary ingredients to your sammiches and/or disrupt other players.
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That

name: Pacific War 1942: Solitaire Travel Game
description:
Pacific War 1942 places you in command of the Allied naval and land forces in the Pacific during World War II. The Japanese AI tries to expand its empire early in the game and overwhelm the Allies. As the Allied player must hold and then push the Japanese back to Japan. Both sides command armies and navies throughout the Pacific. Further, control of the sea areas greatly influences land battles and progress in the Pacific.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: War of 1812: Solitaire Travel Game
description:
War of 1812 Solitaire places you in command of American forces trying to invade and occupy Canada. The British AI side defends the empire. Both sides have armies on fronts in play, ships on the Great Lakes and must deal with Native American warriors and their influence in the Northwest.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Monopoly: The Super Mario Bros. Movie Edition
description:
With this action-packed Monopoly The Super Mario Bros. Movie Edition kids board game, fans can explore the Mushroom Kingdom, as they buy, sell, and trade locations from The Super Mario universe! Enjoy iconic Mario artwork, characters, and themes inspired by the film. Gold coins take the place of Monopoly cash in this race to see who can collect the most coins to win. Earn even more by owning matching Property sets. But beware of Bowser, who can swipe properties, steal coins, or send players to Jail! Discover Warp Pipe shortcuts, and gather or lose coins with Question Blocks and Piranha Plants!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Negotiation, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Forest Shuffle: UKGE 2024 Promo Card
description:
Robin and Water Vole Promo Card given at UK Games Expo 2024

Robin Ablity: 1 Point Per Insect
Water Vole Ability: Immediately play any number of cards from hand as tree saplings
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Zuuli: Mika (The Mole) Promo Card
description:
Promo Card given at UK Games Expo 2024

Scores +1 for each other animal in the same enclosure.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Hail Caesar: Caesar's Gallic Wars
description:
Gaius Julius Caesar used the Helvetii tribe’s migration as casus belli (cause for war), initiating almost a decade worth of campaigning in Transalpine Gaul and beyond. This supplement follows the year-by-year narrative of Caesar’s campaign, presenting Hail Caesar scenarios for each of the major encounters and battles.

Caesar’s Gallic Wars includes a detailed history of the campaign, featuring 44 scenarios, and army lists for Caesar’s Roman Legions and the Helvetii, Belgae, Gaul, Germani and Briton tribes they fought.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Rival Restaurants: SPORKS Out
description:
Following the events of Back for Seconds, the culinary kingdoms of the world have been rigorously forging gastronomical gladiators to wield tools of tremendous power, known as the S.P.O.R.K.S. (Super Powerful Object to Revolutionize the Kitchen). Hailing from the beaches of Hawaii, to the rivers of Thailand and even to the sands of Morocco – five new titans of the table have landed and it’s time for a culinary throwdown. If you want to claim kitchen supremacy, it’s time for the food gloves to come off, because it’s SPORKS OUT!

In SPORKS Out, 5 new chefs, championed by 5 new restaurants have joined the ascension for culinary stardom. Each of the new chefs comes equipped with a physical 3D SPORK that fully integrates with their chef power. If you can properly wield the SPORKS, kitchen domination will not be far behind.

SPORKS Out also adds a new phase to the day, the Action Auction. Before Money and Move, players will get to bid with their leftover money from the previous day to buy one or two action cards from the powerful Snackle Box.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Negotiation, Real-Time, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: D√©kal
description:
The challenge of Dékal is to rid yourself of cards to leave as few points as possible.

To set up, deal sixteen cards to each player, who arranges them in a face-down 4x4 grid. Cards range from 1 to 10, with ten copies of each number.

To start, each player reveals a card of their choice from the grid. Starting with whoever revealed the lowest number, each player claims a revealed card and slides it into their grid to close the gap they created when they removed a card.

The starting player keeps rotating clockwise as players do this fifteen more times, eventually having a fully face-up 4x4 grid. Each number in a grid that's adjacent to the same number is removed, and the sum of the remaining cards is your score. Whoever has the lowest score wins.

Alternatively, play multiple rounds until a player reaches 100 points, then once again whoever has the lowest score wins.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: 4Forces
description:
A card game where you will have to defeat your opponent.
To do this you have to play creature cards, advance along the board and reach the end of it to deal damage to the enemy player.

You will have to pay everything with gems. Gems are everything in this universe: the way to get energy and the currency that everyone uses.

You will also use machines and forces that will help you advance faster, avoid your opponents or make them not move.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction

name: GHQ
description:
Kurt Vonnegut’s first novel, Player Piano, was published in 1954. While it was critically well received and reprinted in 1955, it was not a financial success. As he worked on his next novel (which would eventually become Cat’s Cradle) he needed to supplement his income with other endeavors.

One of those efforts was an original board game called GHQ (General Headquarters). He designed it throughout 1956 and attempted to sell it to game companies, an effort that was ultimately unsuccessful. His notes on the game were filed away and Vonnegut’s GHQ was lost to us.

Until now.

GHQ is a fast and strategic two player battle game. Played on a standard 8x8 checkerboard, players command infantry, armored vehicles, artillery, and the powerful airborne regiment, maneuvering to capture the opposing Headquarters. Can you skillfully use real-world combined arms tactics and call
on reinforcements at the right time to turn the tide of battle?

This first edition of GHQ features deluxe wooden pieces and a 24 page commentary booklet, showing Kurt Vonnegut’s actual design notes to give insight into his creative process.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Zone of Control

name: Battle Royale: Last One Standing
description:
On a tropical Island in the middle of the ocean, an epic battle is about to start!

Four groups of warriors will fight one another until there's only one left standing. The winner will gain ultimate control! But beware: the enemy warriors are not the only threat you face. The island itself, with its explosive eruptions and treacherous grounds, is just as dangerous.

In this fun strategy game, you play cards to move your warriors to strategic positions on the board; you then roll the Doom Dice to manipulate the island itself. As the Island gets smaller and smaller, you must do all you can to keep as many of your warriors alive: Create majorities on tiles, push enemy warriors off the island and stay clear of the explosions. Get Ready for the ultimate Battle Royale.

—description from the publihser
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Map Reduction

name: Mini Crimes: The Best Defense
description:
In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

Mini Crimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyse a crime scene and up to 10 clues.
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

In Mini Crimes: The Best Defense, the body of Mike Miller, owner of the Big Brothers Gym, lies a few meters from the doorway of the gym. Still, he didn’t seem to have any enemy…

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Cat Sudoku: Summer Festival
description:
The core objective of Summer Festival revolves around the classic Sudoku challenge, but with a colorful twist and additional strategic elements to enhance gameplay.

Summer Festival is an engaging Cat Sudoku card game designed for 1 to 4 players. The main goal is to place numbered and colored cards on a 3x3 grid, ensuring that each number and color is unique within its respective row and column. Additionally, players strive to strategically place cards in their designated area to collect reserve tokens and accumulate points.

When the game ends, players will score points based on the number of cards played in their score zone minus unplaced reserve cards that are still in their player area. The player who scores the highest points wins the game. In case of a tie, the player who has the most reserve tokens wins. In case of another tie, players share the win.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Number, Puzzle
mechanics: Advantage Token, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: King of Tokyo Duel
description:
As night falls on Tokyo, two massive silhouettes rise from the smoke snaking up from destroyed skyscrapers. There can only be one who will be crowned King of Tokyo, either by annihilating their Rival or by inspiring terror and awe from the crowds.

King of Tokyo Duel is a 2 players Tug of War Dice game in the King of Tokyo Line.

Choose your monster with a unique power and Roll new dice to draw the Fame And Destruction tokens towards you...
Or Smash your rival with new special Power Cards to become the ultimate King of Tokyo!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Tug of War

name: Blood on the Sands
description:
A historically inspired game allowing players to engage in one on one gladiatorial combats in the arena. It is a dynamic back and forth duel as the player’s miniatures move around the arena.
Each gladiator type will have their own information sheet, on which players record injuries and fatigue, and track such things as favour (and disfavour!) from the crowd depending on how well they are pleasing the paying public!
Each turn players will throw 6 action dice which determines what they can do this turn - such as move, attack and defend themselves.
To be successful the player will need to carefully balance the need to be aggressive to please the crowd, and deal with their own reducing abilities as fatigue and injuries take their toll.
The game is played on a hex grid which greatly speeds movement and adds to the dynamic free-flowing play.
mechanics: Player Elimination

name: Zuuli: Unicorn Promo Card
description:
Promo Card given at conventions and via the online store.

Immediately wins the game if kept in an enclosure with Elephant, Grizzly Bear and Jellyfish.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Melding and Splaying, Set Collection

name: Zuuli: Convention Center Promo Card
description:
Promo Card given at AireCon 2024

Scores 3x points but has 0 capacity.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Melding and Splaying, Set Collection

name: Donuts by the Dozen
description:
Flip some delicious donuts to reach the number 12! In Donuts by the dozen, players flip numbered donut tiles and try to make equation to reach 12. In the meantime, the other players have bee tokens they can play to steal your donuts by making the right math! Be the first to get a full box of Donuts to win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Memory

name: Begone!
description:
In Begone, 2-4 players take the roles of Yokai-banishers, trying to send these mythical creatures back where they belong. Of course, this is not as easy as it seems. Moreover, Yokai can be quite useful. Players will balance utilizing the benefits of some Yokai while attacking others in a race to be the first to both score 30 points and banish a Yokai.

As play progresses, players will add Yokai to a communal play area, increasing the potency of the various Yokai powers as they do so. These powers will allow players to manipulate the cards in hand, steal cards from other players, banish other Yokai more easily, or maybe even score points in unique ways.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection

name: Flesh and Blood: Part the Mistveil
description:
Venture into the cloaked valleys of Misteria to uncover ancient truths and traditions that will reshape your mind, body, and soul! Part the Mistveil features three new heroes across Assassin, Ninja, and Illusionist classes, as well as the incredible new Mystic talent.

Master the sacred arts to transcend beyond your natural limitations, unlocking hidden abilities powered by a unique new resource - Chi! Seduce your enemies into letting their guard down with Nuu, harness the power of Crouching Tigers with Zen, and ward off threats with the mysterious Enigma!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Manic Minute
description:
Manic Minute is a fast-paced talking game where players must attempt to speak non-stop for one minute without hesitation, deviation, or repetition on a given topic in order to win some moves and maybe the game!

Sounds so simple but when you're doing the talking and everyone else is waiting for you to 'trip up' so they can hit that bell, steal a move and take over the round, it's anything but easy.

So take a deep breath, grab some family and friends and get ready to play the game where a MINUTE can feel like a lifetime.

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Storytelling

name: Upzzle
description: The strategic stacking puzzle game. Roll the die, then stack your puzzle pieces without bridging gaps or hanging off the board. The first player to use all their pieces wins! This 3D puzzle game for adults and kids is the perfect brainteaser, puzzle game, and brain puzzle all in one!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Layering, Tile Placement

name: Impossible Mission
description:
You're a spy inside the enemy complex, an underground building, a labyrinth of corridors. Empty, except for the security drones, always vigilant, you search every inch, look inside every desk and trash can, scan every computer.
Your goal is to gather enough intelligence to get 2 complete Unlock actions, and then escape before time runs out...

Impossible Mission is an action-selection, hand-management solitaire game, where you hold a hand of actions, and acquire new ones by searching through the many hiding spots in the building.
Managing your hand is critical to complete your mission, since every round you lose stamina and remove actions from your deck.
Every turn, the drones chase after you, and they can also cause you to lose action cards.

If you complete 2 Unlock actions, matching all 5 symbols in a single play, and then make it to the exit, you win the game.

[GAMEPLAY]
Each turn, you will:

Play action cards from your hand in any order, as many as you can or want to.
Discard all cards from your play area onto a discard pile.
Move the drones towards your pawn.
Reset the action deck if it’s empty.
Draw 5 cards (or as many as possible) from the action deck into your hand.


Additionally, whenever you complete an Unlock card or when you're caught by a drone, you must also reset your deck.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mandatory Fun
description:
"All the fun of Cards Against Humanity with none of the penis jokes."

Mandatory Fun is a safe-for-work party game in the tradition of Cards Against Humanity and Apples to Apples. Instead of focusing on the obscene (Cards Against Humanity) or generic (Apples to Apples), it focuses on themes relevant to the players. For example, if playing with your Dungeons and Dragons group the deck may include cards referencing notable events from your campaigns.

The game is played as follows (from game booklet): At the beginning of each round, each player draws until they have 10 White Cards. A player is selected as the first Card Commander and plays a Red Card. They read the question or phrase on the card with authority and demand other players submit their most entertaining (& appropriate) White Card. Each other player submits a White Card, face down, to the Card Commander. After shuffling the other players' submitted cards, the Card Commander reads each possible Red-White card pairing to the group. The Card Commander then decides whose White Card is most entertaining (& appropriate) and that player gets one point. The next round, a different Card Commander is selected to dispense more Mandatory Fun.
mechanics: Drawing, Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Creepshow: The Suspense Building Game
description:
In this competitive story-building game, players will be playing as "Creeps" and will create deliciously horrible stories and send bad people to their well deserved demises.

The game is played with Story cards and suspense cards to build stories for villain cards. Story cards work together to form a chain that tells a story for each villain in three acts. Suspense cards are the fuel that makes the story work!

On your turn, you will have the choice to either "Creep" or "Show"!

When you "Creep" you may first discard any number of Story cards in your hand you no longer want and then draw back up to 7. Then you must play a Suspense card (valued -2,1,2,or 3) face down to any villain's stack so other player's won't know what you played!

When you "Show" you may play a story card from your hand to a villain's story chain. These will have various effects from earning points, looking at suspense already there, and adding suspense cards of your own!

Occasionally, these story cards will have a branching path on them, where you can choose both how the story goes and make a guess at how much suspense this villain has accumulated. If the suspense is equal to or more than your choice you'll earn some points and adjust the suspense stack in some way before the next turn.

When a villain is in act 3 of their story, you could instead use the "Show" action to play an available ending card in an high/low outcome to potentially score big points! If you also happen to have the most suspense on the Villain and you get the higher outcome where the villain meets their end, you'll also score the villain card!

HOWEVER, if you play an ending and get the lower outcome and the villain escapes, other devious players with suspense on that villain will score a few points instead and no one will score the villain card! Hopefully, they at least learned their lesson!

When you reach the bottom of the villain deck, you'll face a major villain which will be worth more points than the normal villain and far more deserving of the vile twists and turns you have in store for them!

BUT BE WARNED! If a major villain escapes, the player who attempted to end their story cannot win the game!

The game ends when the major villain's story does.

No matter your strategy, use your suspense cards wisely and try not to let any of the villains escape the fates they've worked so hard to earn...

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Horror, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Push Your Luck, Storytelling

name: Rise to Glory
description:
Rise to Glory is a civilization-building game in which players explore a random map and compete to earn the most glory by researching technologies, building wonders, conquering cites, acquiring great artworks, and launching a starship.

Players bid for technologies, trade resources and buildings, and pay each other royalties to build units. They can wage war or join forces against other players, barbarians, or pirates.

What makes Rise to Glory different and unique?

Epic feel as players develop technologies and deploy big armies.
Random map that players gradually unveil and explore.
Straightforward mechanics (minimal fuss, maximum fun!).
Extensive player interactions (bidding, trading, fighting...).
Balanced game system that keeps all players engaged‚Äà(no elimination).
Barbarians & ‚Äàpirates to spice things up—hordes can be unleashed!
Player differentiation with leaders, wonders, unit levels....
Engaging combat system with surprise attacks and alliances.
Random events that can be player-specific or affect all players.
Extensively play-tested over many years.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction: Sealed Bid, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Income, Modular Board, Movement Points, Negotiation, Set Collection, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Trading, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: Tentacle Tantrum
description: Tentacle Tantrum is an aquatic-themed, matching, dexterity game for 2-6 players. Each turn starts with a player rolling a set of custom dice, one with 6 colors and one with 6 sea creatures. Then all players race in an attempt be the first to stick the suction cup of their octopus arm to a tile of a colored sea creature which matches either of the rolled dice, or both for a bonus. The player who rolls the dice rotates after each turn. Play continues until all the tiles have been collected, at which point the player who collected the most is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Matching, Real-Time

name: Tyrano Race: Gigantik Floor Game
description: Players place a large flexible game mat on the floor. The players will pick and race dinosaur figures around the mat by rolling a soft die. The first dinosaur to get to the middle of the board wakes and then becomes the Tyranosaurus Rex. The first Dinosaur to escape back to the start is the winner, unless they all get eaten by the T-Rex!.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move
